_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Dry, Condensed, and Evaporated Dairy Product Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary

The operations at Milk Specialties Global - Fond du Lac include processing whey.  An ammonia refrigeration system is used to provide cooling of tanks and chillers.



Milk Specialties Global is committed to the health and safety of its employees and the community, and to the protection of the environment.  Therefore, Milk Specialties Global - Fond du Lac is complying with EPA's Risk Management Plan (RMP) regulations, Title 40 CFR Part 68, in conjunction with OSHA's Process Safety Management (PSM) Standard, Title 29 Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) 1910.119, which deals with the risks of storing, handling, and processing hazardous chemicals.  Milk Specialties Global - Fond du Lac has completed the RMP and PSM program requirements to educate and protect its employees, the public, and the environment with respect to the anhydrous ammonia located at the facility.



Management System

Milk Specialties Global - Fond du Lac has developed a Management System in accordance with 40 CFR 68.15 to oversee the implementation of the RMP elements.  The Management System identifies the title of the individual with the overall responsibility for the development, implementation, and integration of the RMP elements.  The Management System is documented to ensure effective communications through MSG, clarify the roles and responsibilities of MSG personnel, and to ensure that the RMP program elements are integrated into an ongoing approach to identify hazards and manage risks. 



Off-site Consequence Analyses

As part of the RMP, worst-case and alternate case release scenarios have been evaluated.  The worst-case scenario is a release from the largest receiver, which was determined to be the high pressure receiver. In accordance with the RMP, the high pressure receiver was assumed to be released within a 10-minute period.  



The following assumptions were used for the worst-case scenario:



?    Wind speed of 1.5 meters/second;

?    F stability class; and

?    Toxic end

point of 200 ppm (0.14 mg/l) for ammonia.



Milk Specialties Global - Fond du Lac is located in the city limits of Fond du Lac.  Based on the surroundings, the area was considered urban for the purpose of the analysis.  The distance to impact was determined using the EPA program RMP*Comp.



For the alternate-case release scenario, several scenarios were considered including a failure in the condenser piping (outside), a pinhole in the piping released within the building, a pressure relief valve release, and a glycol chiller hit by fork truck (inside).  The relief valve release was chosen for the alternate scenario included in the RMP submittal. Based on Appendix E (Supplemental Guidance for Ammonia Refrigeration) in the General Guidance on Risk Management Programs for Chemical Accident Prevention, the following simplified version of Bernoulli's Equation was used to calculate the ammonia release:



QR = HA x (203) (Pg)0.5



    Where:

        QR = Release rate (pounds per minute)

        HA = Hole area (square inches)

        Pg = Gauge Pressure (psig)



Additionally, the following assumptions are made for the alternate scenario:



?    Wind speed of 3 meters/second;

?    D stability class; and

?    Toxic endpoint of 200 ppm (0.14 mg/l) for ammonia.



The area was considered urban for the purpose of the analysis.  The analysis took into account the partial mitigation of an enclosure.  The distance to impact was determined using the EPA program RMP*Comp.



Five-Year Accident History



There were no accidents to report for the last five years.



Prevention Program

Milk Specialties Global - Fond du Lac has adopted safety programs to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of a significant release of ammonia.  The programs focus on rules, procedures and practices which govern the ammonia refrigeration system.  The programs are subject to the requirements of an EPA RMP Prevention Program 3 facility.  A Program 3 facility is a facility which does not meet the requirements

of a Program 1 facility (e.g. the Program 3 worst-case release scenario reaches off site, the facility has had a significant accident within the previous 5 years, or the facility emergency response procedures are not coordinated with off-site responders) and which is subject to the OSHA PSM standard 29 CFR 1910.119. For the Milk Specialties Global - Fond du Lac facility, the worst-case release scenario reaches off site and the facility is subject to the OSHA PSM Standard 29 CFR 1910.119. 



The Milk Specialties Global - Fond du Lac Prevention Program follows the OSHA PSM standard and is based on guidance from the International Institute of Ammonia Refrigeration (IIAR).  Specifically, the sections covered by both the RMP and OSHA PSM program include:



1)    Process Safety Information

2)    Process Hazard Analysis

3)    Operating Procedures

4)    Training

5)    Mechanical Integrity

6)    Management of Change

7)    Pre-Startup Review

8)    Compliance Audits

9)    Incident Investigation

10)    Employee Participation

11)    Hot Work Permits

12)    Contractors



The PSM elements have been put in place to protect the Milk Specialties Global - Fond du Lac employees, as well as to protect public health and the environment. 



Emergency Response Program

The facility's Emergency Response Program is based on the OSHA requirements for Emergency Response under 29 CFR 1910.38 and 1910.119.  The facility has written and maintains an Emergency Response Program which provides for detailed:



?    Procedures for informing the public and emergency response agencies about accidental releases.



?    Documentation of proper first aid and emergency medical treatment to treat accidental human exposures.



?    Procedures and measure for emergency response after an accidental release of regulated substance.



?    Procedures for using, testing, and maintaining emergency response equipment.



?    Training to employees on relevant procedures.



?    Procedures to review and update the Emergency Response plan. 



The Pro

gram is coordinated with the local Fond du Lac Fire Department (FDLFD) and the facility emergency response contractor, Kuhlman.



Through the ongoing implementation of the PSM/RMP program, Milk Specialties Global continuously looks for safety improvements to the facility.  For example, training of maintenance technicians will occur as part of a continuing education program.
